sprint_goal: Implement a secure, end-to-end user authentication system and de-risk the DICOM viewer.
epic_coverage: User Authentication & Authorization,Security & Compliance,DICOM Viewer & Image Manipulation
key_deliverables: Functional login screen; Secure credential storage; Encrypted database connections; GPU rendering PoC.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate successful user login; Show encrypted data in DB; Demonstrate working DirectX PoC.
success_criteria: User can log in; All security tasks pass integration tests; Feasibility of DirectX approach is confirmed.
risk_factors: RISK-001: Technical complexity of DirectX; RISK-002: Complexity of pgcrypto integration.
mitigation_strategies: The spike (TASK-VIEW-001) is the primary mitigation for RISK-001; Allocate senior developer to pgcrypto task.
integration_windows: Internal integration testing throughout the sprint.
burndown_target: Front-load spike task; aim for 50% completion by day 4.

sprint_goal: Implement Role-Based Access Control, foundational user management capabilities, and core viewer rendering.
epic_coverage: User Authentication & Authorization,System Administration & Configuration,Security & Compliance,DICOM Viewer & Image Manipulation
key_deliverables: Role-based UI visibility; Admin can create users; Audit logging for user creation; Core GPU rendering control.
demo_objectives: Log in as Technician and show hidden Admin UI; Log in as Admin and create a new user; Show audit log entry for user creation; Demonstrate a DICOM image rendered via the new GPU control.
success_criteria: RBAC correctly enforced in UI; User creation flow is functional and audited; Core rendering control can display DICOMs.
risk_factors: RISK-001: Potential for performance issues or memory leaks in the rendering control.
mitigation_strategies: Pair programming and rigorous code reviews for all DirectX code; Use GPU profiling tools.
integration_windows: Integration of user management UI with backend services on day 6-7.
burndown_target: Prioritize TASK-VIEW-002 as it's the highest-effort task.

sprint_goal: Secure user sessions with auto-lock and enable the core DICOM data ingestion pipeline.
epic_coverage: User Authentication & Authorization,DICOM C-STORE SCP & Data Ingestion,DICOM Viewer & Image Manipulation,System Administration & Configuration
key_deliverables: Automatic session lock/unlock; DICOM C-STORE SCP listener; Decoupled ingestion via RabbitMQ; Progressive image loading; Password reset functionality.
demo_objectives: Show session locking after short inactivity period and successful unlock; Send a study from a test SCU and show it appear in the system; Open a large study and demonstrate progressive loading.
success_criteria: Session lock feature is functional and compliant; System can successfully receive and persist DICOM studies; Viewer performance for large studies is improved.
risk_factors: RISK-004: DICOM interoperability issues with test SCU; RISK-008: Data integrity between file system and DB during ingestion.
mitigation_strategies: Use standard-compliant test tools (DCMTK); Design ingestion consumer to be idempotent and transactional.
integration_windows: End-to-end DICOM ingestion testing from day 5 onwards.

sprint_goal: Deliver a clinically useful viewer with essential tools and enable PACS integration.
key_deliverables: Interactive WW/WL, Zoom, Pan tools; PACS configuration UI; C-FIND and C-MOVE functionality.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate all interactive viewer tools; Configure a new connection to a test PACS and verify it; Search the test PACS for studies; Retrieve a selected study to the local system.
success_criteria: All viewer tools are functional and performant; Users can configure and query a remote PACS; Studies can be retrieved successfully.
risk_factors: RISK-004: C-FIND/C-MOVE interoperability issues with the test PACS.
mitigation_strategies: Implement detailed DICOM logging to debug protocol-level issues; Test against multiple open-source PACS implementations (Orthanc, dcm4che).
external_dependencies: Test PACS server must be available.
integration_windows: End-to-end PACS Query/Retrieve testing from day 4 onwards.

sprint_goal: Create a reliable deployment and operational framework.
epic_coverage: Deployment & Operations,Advanced Printing, PDF Export, and Email
key_deliverables: MSIX Installer with service registration; First-run prerequisite check wizard; Automated database backup feature; Asynchronous printing foundation.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate a full install/uninstall on a clean VM; Show the first-run configuration wizard; Configure and trigger a manual database backup; Submit a print job and show it being processed asynchronously.
success_criteria: The MSIX installer provides a smooth installation experience; DB backups are successfully created; Print jobs are offloaded to the background service.
risk_factors: RISK-006: Deployment failures due to environmental prerequisites; MSIX custom scripting complexity.
mitigation_strategies: Develop a standalone 'Environment Pre-flight Check' utility; Create exhaustive deployment documentation.
external_dependencies: Code signing certificate required for final build.
integration_windows: Installer testing on clean VMs from day 5 onwards.
